meanings.definition: The state or quality of being childish or immature.
meanings.sent1: Her puerility was evident in her constant giggling and silly jokes.
meanings.sent2: His puerility often showed in his refusal to take responsibility for his actions.
meanings.sent3: The puerility of the situation made everyone laugh at the office party.
meanings.sent4: The puerility of their argument over a toy car seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent5: The puerility of his behavior was a stark reminder of his young age.

meanings.definition: An act or expression of childishness or immaturity.
meanings.sent1: The puerility of his tantrum surprised everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help but laugh at the puerility of his attempts to impress her.
meanings.sent3: The puerility of their game of tag brought back memories of carefree days.
meanings.sent4: The puerility of their teasing masked a deeper bond between the siblings.
meanings.sent5: The puerility of his excuses for not doing his homework was amusing to his teacher.
